ci_support_linux_64_channel_sourcesconda:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,conda-forge/label/python_rc
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.14.* *_cp314
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
DEAP is a novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of
ideas. It seeks to make algorithms explicit and data structures transparent. It works
in perfect harmony with parallelisation mechanism such as multiprocessing and SCOOP. The
following documentation presents the key concepts and many features to build your own
evolutions.

in perfect harmony with parallelisation mechanism such as multiprocessing and SCOOP. The
following documentation presents the key concepts and many features to build your own
evolutions.

name: deap

about.description:
DEAP is a novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of
ideas. It seeks to make algorithms explicit and data structures transparent. It works
in perfect harmony with parallelisation mechanism such as multiprocessing and SCOOP. The
following documentation presents the key concepts and many features to build your own
evolutions.

DEAP is a novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of
ideas. It seeks to make algorithms explicit and data structures transparent. It works
in perfect harmony with parallelisation mechanism such as multiprocessing and SCOOP. The
following documentation presents the key concepts and many features to build your own
evolutions.

raw_meta_yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prefix-dev/recipe-format/main/schema.json
schema_version: 1

context:
  version: 1.4.3

package:
  name: deap
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/d/deap/deap-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 7c97088fb05835bdc255bec475cb0e778de2b43e44cbefbf2bcd655aeec865fd

build:
  number: 1
  script:
    - if: unix
      then:
        - ${{ PYTHON }} setup.py build_ext -I${{ PREFIX }}/include
      else:
        - ${{ PYTHON }} setup.py build_ext -I"%LIBRARY_INC%"
    - ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv --no-build-isolation --disable-pip-version-check

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler("c") }}
    - ${{ compiler("cxx") }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - numpy
        - python
  host:
    - numpy
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - numpy
    - python

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - deap
        - deap.benchmarks
        - deap.tools
        - deap.tools._hypervolume
  - files:
      source:
        - tests/
    requirements:
      run:
        - pytest-cov
    script:
      - coverage run --source=deap --branch -m pytest -vv --tb=long --color=yes
      - coverage report --show-missing --skip-covered --fail-under=37

about:
  license: LGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python
  homepage: https://github.com/DEAP/deap
  repository: https://github.com/deap/deap
  documentation: https://deap.readthedocs.io
  description: |
    DEAP is a novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of
    ideas. It seeks to make algorithms explicit and data structures transparent. It works
    in perfect harmony with parallelisation mechanism such as multiprocessing and SCOOP. The
    following documentation presents the key concepts and many features to build your own
    evolutions.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bollwyvl
    - rhiever
    - tonyfast
